item.title: Report I-2024080111
item.description:
Report I-2024080111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: Sherman
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was unloading Sulfuric at GlobITech Sherman TX dry mate broke on the fill line to tank as the driver was offloading sulfuric acid. There was a 200ft hose and Globitech employee assisting with transfer. The PVC line broke spilling<10 gallons of material into containment. The material splashed on the Globitech employee burning him on his back. He was rinsed in the EW.SS and went to the hospital. He was released the same day and made a full recovery.

item.title: Report E-2024090370
item.description:
Report E-2024090370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LEP experienced a UN1866 Bulldog Adhesion Promoter release from 2 boxes each containing (6) 1-quart metal bottles. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6 quarts of product released to a 3’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor and a 3’ x 4’ area of the concrete lot below. The cans were damaged as a result of being crushed due to stacking/improper loading. The (8) damaged cans were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard, pads, and absorbents used to clean the spill were placed into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090347
item.description:
Report E-2024090347

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured bottle of hazardous product, Instant Power® Heavy Duty Drain Opener. The plastic bottle was punctured by a forklift blade that resulted in the release of approximately 1-gallon of product onto the pallet and wooden trailer floor in an 8’x2’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release using KolorSafe Liquid Neutralizer and applied oil dry. The neutralized impacted pallet was cut-up and containerized into a 95-gallon DF. The neutralized impacted absorbents, PPE, and product were containerized into a 55-gallon DF. XPO will manage the waste until end disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024091064
item.description:
Report X-2024091064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: There were 8 boxes in the shipment each containing 4 cans. One of the boxes appears to have been crushed by freight in transit before arriving to service center 177, but the damage went unnoticed to the customer facility. The customer refused 5 of the 8 boxes due to the damaged can leaking onto the other boxes. It was then noticed that service center 070 noted that the shipment was damaged but did not note the type of damage and sent it on to 177. CURA was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024091130
item.description:
Report X-2024091130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: ALPINE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET FROM INSIDE OUT WHEN BEING UNLOADED. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO SPILL. DESIGNATED RESPONDER DON ON PPE AND CLEAN THE INITAL SPILL. RESPONDER THEN TOOK LEAKING PACKAGE TO DMP TO PROCESS. RESPONDER IDENTIFIED 5 GALLON BUCKET DENTED AND LEAKED FROM LID. RESPONDER THEN CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK TO DETERMINE IT THIS WAS A UNDELCARED HAZMAT PACKAGE. PACKAGE PROCESED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2024090382
item.description:
Report E-2024090382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: VEGA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO called in to report a 5-gallon spill of UN1263 "DURANAR BONE WHITE" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by what appears to be improper loading which resulted in a dent toward the bottom of the drum. The spill has impacted the trailer floor and the asphalt of Pilot Travel Center. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed 3-gallons of UN1263 "DURANAR BONE WHITE" product released to 3'x3' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents to the impacted area. The damaged drum was overpacked into a 95-gallon poly waste drum. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Amarillo, TX for terminal personnel to manage. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-13
  • City: AUSTIN

item.title: Report E-2024090317
item.description:
Report E-2024090317

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO terminal LEP called in to report an 11-gallon spill of UN1993 "Biobor®JF" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a forklift puncture that impacted trailer and dock floors. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and advised that due the respiratory hazards presented by the material, a contractor response is recommended which the caller agreed to. Contactors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 15 gallons released to a 10'x6' area of the concrete dock floor. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.
